pr_title: Move Aggregator and implementation to aggregators package

timeline.bodyText: we had added this to avoid the instanceOf checks in the merge methods. Why remove it now?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: With generics it becomes very hard to encapsulate this class in another class. For example to use this in AbstractBoundInstrument I have to use generics there as well (maybe I am too new in generics in Java).
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Also I commented in the description why I changed this.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I follow the reasoning yet. Hard to see in isolation in this PR, rather that in the context of where you want to use it. I'd be ok if you wanted to get things working, then I could go back and see if I could clean up the overall structure, so we don't have to be doing instanceof all the time.
replies.author: jkwatson

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregators/Aggregator.java b/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregator/Aggregator.java
similarity index 96%
rename from sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregators/Aggregator.java
rename to sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregator/Aggregator.java
index 2f19935e3..a93a17c58 100644
--- a/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregators/Aggregator.java
+++ b/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregator/Aggregator.java

@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@
  * limitations under the License.
  */
 
-package io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.aggregators;
+package io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.aggregator;
 
 import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;

timeline.bodyText: hmm. this smells like we might not have the right class/interface structure. Can we make the recordable type a parameter of the aggregator type?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: not sure I understand the proposal, can you clarify a bit, maybe add a small example.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
If all the aggegrators need both methods on them, and all of them throw an UOE with one of them, that seems like the interface isn't really helping us out.
If we had an Aggregator<T>, then you could just have a record(T value) on that interface, and each implementation would only have to have one record method, rather than two.
DoubleSumAggregator implements Aggregator<Double> then.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I do wonder if the interface ends up being some extra baggage to carry around, though. I'll keep an eye on this as things evolve.
replies.author: jkwatson

similarity index 96%
rename from sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregators/DoubleSumAggregator.java
rename to sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregator/DoubleSumAggregator.java

--- a/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregators/DoubleSumAggregator.java
+++ b/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/aggregator/DoubleSumAggregator.java

@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@
  * limitations under the License.
  */
 
-package io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.aggregators;
+package io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.aggregator;
 
 import com.google.common.util.concurrent.AtomicDouble;

timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: import or leave out the package, since we're in the same package.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.message:
Move Aggregator and implementation to aggregators package

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Cristian Drutu <bogdandrutu@gmail.com>

Fix comment imports

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Cristian Drutu <bogdandrutu@gmail.com>

aggregators -> aggregator
